item.title: Ticket #1526 (have wp-atom.php generate Atom 1.0 (fix attached)) updated
item.dc:creator: yngwin
item.description:
Matt: I didn't want an edit war, but I do believe this is important, and wanted an explanation from your side. Thanks for listing your reasons, finally.

I agree with you that the existing patches were lacking. As WP cannot ensure well-formed XHTML, we need to escape the content. Luckily, Atom 1.0 allows that. In the patch I have just uploaded I have corrected that. The patch works for me, and my aggregator (Sage extension in Firefox) has no problem with it. Could you please test this and consider including it into the 2.0 release if it works?

I disagree with you on the enhancement classification. How can an invalid feed not be a bug?

item.title: Ticket #2086 (Metadata Post Ordering) created
item.dc:creator: sollaires
item.description:
This patch to /wp-includes/classes.php adds the ability to sort posts by their metadata fields in addition to the standard, sortable fields. This method enhances the query param 'orderby' such that a field name not in the list of allowed fields is assumed to be a meta data key. An additional query param, 'ordercast', was created to handle the case where the values of the meta data fields are not strings, but something else. It could be the case that, really, the only kind of data that we care about is numeric, so instead of taking the MySQL column type (signed, unsigned, decimal, etc), it could take something simpler and more understandable. My current example using this feature is at ​http://nonninja.net/wsph/category/game-reviews/ (however, at this very moment, all the posts are private. So it's not very exciting). 

---
/wp-includes/classes.php (Patch file)
---
233a234
> 		$extra_selects = array();
472c473
< 			$q['orderby']='date '.$q['order'];
---
> 			$q['orderby']='post_date '.$q['order'];
480c481,495
< 				$orderby_array[0] = 'date';
---
> 				// if the user passed in a field that is not in the "allowed keys," try to join with the meta table to
> 				// sort via a meta_value
> 				$meta_key = $orderby_array[0];
> 				$orderby_array[0] = "meta_value";
> 				$join .= " LEFT JOIN $wpdb->postmeta ON ($wpdb->posts.ID = $wpdb->postmeta.post_id AND $wpdb->postmeta.meta_key = '".$meta_key."')";
> 				if( !empty( $q['ordercast'] ) ) {
> 					$extra_selects[] = 'CAST(meta_value AS '.$q['ordercast'].') AS meta_value';
> 				}
>
> 			//$join = " LEFT JOIN $wpdb->post2cat ON ($wpdb->posts.ID = $wpdb->post2cat.post_id) ";
> 				//$orderby_array[0] = $q;
> 			}
> 			$q['orderby'] = '';
> 			if( in_array($orderby_array[0],$allowed_keys) ) {
> 				$q['orderby'] = 'post_';
482c497
< 			$q['orderby'] = $orderby_array[0].' '.$q['order'];
---
> 			$q['orderby'] .= $orderby_array[0].' '.$q['order'];
487a503,504
> 					} else {
> 						$q['orderby'] .= ','.$orderby_array[$i].' '.$q['order'];
548c565
< 		$orderby = "post_" . $q['orderby'];
---
> 		$orderby = $q['orderby'];
550,551c567,571
< 		$request = " SELECT $distinct * FROM $wpdb->posts $join WHERE 1=1".$where." ORDER BY " . $orderby . " $limits";
<
---
> 		if( !empty( $extra_selects ) ) {
> 			$select = ','.join(', ',$extra_selects);
> 		}
> 		$request = " SELECT $distinct * $select FROM $wpdb->posts $join WHERE 1=1".$where." ORDER BY " . $orderby . " $limits";
>
1299c1319
< ?>
\ No newline at end of file
---
> ?>

item.title: functions-post.php.diff attached to Ticket #2085
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description: A patch that recomputes counts for both the old and new categories.

item.title: Ticket #2085 (Posts that have their category changed invalidate category counters.) created
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
If a post is edited after it is published and the category of the post is changed from its original setting, the category counter for the original category is left unadjusted.

The old category's count should be decremented or recomputed.

item.title: Ticket #1526 (have wp-atom.php generate Atom 1.0 (fix attached)) updated
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description:
Severity changed

Well,

  • There is no satisfactory patch available.
  • Aggregators I tried with the existing patch didn't work.
  • We have no way currently to ensure XHTML validity.
  • This is a enhancement, not a bug.
  • This is too big of a change for the 2.0 release.
  • A "priority" edit war isn't going to change any of this.

item.title: Ticket #2083 (WP 2.0 RC1 Zero Sized Object) created
item.dc:creator: nilsjeppe
item.description:
Using an article's date-and-title based permalink results in a zero size object.

​http://gez.pandemonium.de/2005/12/14/willkommen-die-gez-und-ich/

I have tested with both default themes. I have no non-default plugins active when the problem occurs (and the only plugin I have installed at all is the markdown extra plugin.)

No errors in the apache error log.

item.title: plugin generated collapsible boxes.diff attached to Ticket #2082
item.dc:creator: majelbstoat
item.description: Patch to allow collapsible, plugin insertable option groups on the edit pages

item.title: Ticket #2082 (Collapsible boxes for inserted elements on edit form advanced.) created
item.dc:creator: majelbstoat
item.description: The do_action('edit_form_advanced') and do_action('edit_page_form') allows plugin authors to add their own set of options on the advanced edit page or page edit page. However, as it stands, you can't insert a collapsible box because the do_action statement comes before the dbx-group class div. It would be nice to have the do_action statement occur inside that group, so that options can be compressed neatly, like Trackbacks, Optional Excerpts and Custom Fields. If lots of plugins are installed, I could see lots of open boxes stacking up quite high. Attached is a diff that should allow them to be compressed, on both the advanced edit form and also on the page edit form.

item.title: Ticket #2081 (recovering comment from Akismet doesn't increment comment count) created
item.dc:creator: seth
item.description:
To reproduce:

Find a ham comment that Akismet has marked incorrectly as spam. Recover the comment as "Not Spam". The post says it has no comments, even though it shows the comment correctly.

item.title: tiny_nolimits.diff attached to Ticket #2080
item.dc:creator: skeltoac

item.title: Ticket #2080 (make tinyMCE 100% pluggable) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Adding this one little action hook makes it easy for tinyMCE plugins to be added as WP plugins. No need to copy js files into wp-includes, just write the js into a PHP function and add_action.

This will be nice for adding things like spellcheck. Just drop a plugin file in wp-content/plugins and activate it, refresh and there is it. Should work with MU, too.

item.title: Ticket #1937 (All HTML phrase elements should be allowed for comments and posts) updated
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
This patch only adds a handful of infrequently seen tags to kses in the core. Why not enable all of them?

It also doesn't include any changes to enable these tags from TinyMCE, which might not be neccesary for advanced users who aren't using it, but would sure cause havok on posts that were first submitted raw, and then edited in TinyMCE.

Perhaps this is better left to user customization via my-hacks.php, as cautioned in the kses code (and still remains in this patch).

item.title: Ticket #1937 (All HTML phrase elements should be allowed for comments and posts) updated
item.dc:creator: h3h
item.description: Keywords, Version, Summary changed
